ingredients: 1 lb ground meat (lamb, beef, or chicken)
1/4 tsp red chili powder (or more, to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan or pot over medium heat.
Add chopped onions and sauté until softened and translucent.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger, and sauté for another minute until fragrant.
Add ground meat to the pan and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until browned.
Stir in ground cumin, coriander, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Cook for 1 minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Mix well and cook until the tomatoes soften.
Reduce heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the meat is cooked through and the flavors have melded.
Stir in chopped cilantro before serving.
cooking_tips: You can adjust the amount of spices to your preference.
For a richer flavor, you can add a dollop of yogurt or cream at the end.
Serve khima with rice, roti, or naan bread.
Khima can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
